text.text:
I had a wonderful experience staying at Hotel Parc Estique. The rooms were spacious, neat, and very well-maintained, which made my stay extremely comfortable. The room service was prompt and efficient, and the staff was polite and attentive. A special mention to Ashutosh from the staff, who was exceptionally humble and helpful throughout my stay. His courteous behavior truly enhanced the overall experience.

It was a pleasant and satisfying stay—I would definitely recommend this hotel to others looking for comfort and quality service.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Parc Estique Hotel, Viman Nagar, from June 29 to July 1, 2025, in Room No. 525, and I would like to share my feedback.

Firstly, the positives:

The reception staff was extremely humble and supportive, making the check-in and overall experience very pleasant.

The restaurant service was commendable, with delicious food and courteous staff.

The room ambiance was excellent – it was well-scented, had a great view, and was kept tidy.

Room service was prompt, and the staff were polite and professional.

It was also appreciated that the room was stocked with a sufficient number of water bottles.

Areas for improvement:

There was no handwash provided in the bathroom, which is a basic hygiene requirement.

Shampoo and body wash supplies were insufficient for the duration of the stay.

A safety concern: where the wooden and tile flooring meet, a nail was protruding from the floor. Unfortunately, I injured myself twice due to this and had to take a tetanus injection as a precaution.

I hope these points are taken in the right spirit to improve the overall guest experience. Despite the mentioned issues, I appreciate the hospitality and look forward to better arrangements on my next visit.

Being situated in Viman Nagar, it's incredibly convenient, especially if you are in Pune for business or catching a flight. Beyond the location, the hotel had a welcoming vibe. The staff were friendly and attentive, always ready to help with a smile. The rooms were comfortable and well-maintained, providing a relaxing space to unwind after a busy day. It felt like a home away from home. If you are looking for a hotel with great connectivity, Lemon Tree Viman Nagar can be a great choice.

editorialSummary.text: Modern rooms in a upmarket hotel offering free Wi-Fi & breakfast, plus 3 restaurants & a pool.

text.text:
Team Lunch Review – Four Points by Sheraton

We recently had a team lunch at Four Points by Sheraton and overall, it was a great experience. The ambiance was elegant and comfortable, providing a perfect setting for a relaxed team gathering.

We opted for the buffet lunch, which had a good spread of dishes. The food was delicious and well-presented, and everyone appreciated the variety available in the main course and desserts.

However, there are a couple of areas for improvement. The vegetarian starter options were limited, and we would have appreciated a bit more variety for our vegetarian team members. Also, the refilling time for a few dishes was slightly slow, which caused a bit of a wait during peak lunch hour.

That said, the staff was courteous and responsive, and we enjoyed the overall experience. With a few small tweaks, it could be even better. Would still recommend for team lunches and group outings.

text.text:
Attended a wedding reception at Four Points by Sheraton in Pune, and while the venue impressed with its elegant décor and spacious banquet hall, the overall experience was mixed.

1. Ambience & Decor: The venue was beautifully arranged for the wedding, with tasteful lighting and seating that gave a premium feel. It’s an excellent space for large gatherings and special occasions.

2. Service: The staff were courteous and well-coordinated, ensuring guests were attended to promptly. The hospitality was professional throughout the event.

3. Food Quality: This was the most underwhelming part of the evening. The food didn’t quite live up to expectations, especially for a venue of this standard. Flavors were average and lacked the richness you typically expect at a high-end wedding buffet.

4. Location & Accessibility: Conveniently located in Viman Nagar, it’s easily accessible from the airport and other parts of the city, with ample parking space.

Overall, it’s a stylish venue ideal for upscale events, but there’s definitely room for improvement in the food department.

editorialSummary.text: Polished property in a shopping & entertainment complex, offering a gym, a spa & a rooftop pool.

text.text:
Disappointing Stay – Not Worth the 5-Star Tag

I stayed at E-Square The Fern, Pune with my wife and daughter from August 15 to 17, 2025, and unfortunately, the experience was far from what one would expect from a hotel claiming to be 5-star.

Here are the key issues we faced:

Limited Food Options: The breakfast and dinner buffet had very limited variety, especially for vegetarians. The dinner buffet felt overpriced considering the lack of options and quality.
Remote Location: The hotel is located on the outskirts and is not well-known even among locals, making commuting and navigation inconvenient.
Swimming Pool Not Functional: One of the main reasons we chose this hotel was the swimming pool, which was non-operational during our stay. This was extremely disappointing, especially since I had promised my daughter a fun pool experience. I had to alter our plans last minute and spend extra money to take my family to a water park instead.
Poor Housekeeping Service: Despite turning on the “Make My Room” sign before leaving, the room was not cleaned. I had to call housekeeping after returning. Additionally, the staff left an empty glass outside our room, saying it was from the restaurant and someone else would pick it up. It remained there until we checked out the next morning.
Overall Verdict: With the kind of service and amenities provided, this hotel does not deserve a 5-star rating. At best, it should be rated 3 or 3.5 stars. I would not recommend it for families expecting a premium experience.

text.text:
Had a pleasant stay at The E-Square The Fern Hotel in Pune, and it's definitely a place I’d recommend for both business and leisure travelers.

🔹 Location:
Centrally located and well-connected to key parts of the city. The hotel is part of the E-Square complex, which includes a cinema, eateries, and shopping outlets — a big plus for convenience and entertainment.

🔹 Rooms:
Spacious, clean, and thoughtfully designed. The beds were comfortable, and the in-room amenities were modern and functional. Wi-Fi speed was decent, and housekeeping was prompt.

🔹 Dining:
The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of Indian and continental options. Everything was fresh and well-prepared. Their in-house dining menu is also worth trying, especially if you're looking to unwind without stepping out.

🔹 Service:
The staff was courteous and helpful throughout the stay. Check-in and check-out were smooth, though there could be a bit more attentiveness at peak times.

🔹 Ambience:
The overall vibe is modern yet relaxed. The hotel strikes a good balance between a business-friendly environment and a comfortable leisure stay.

originalText.text:
Had a pleasant stay at The E-Square The Fern Hotel in Pune, and it's definitely a place I’d recommend for both business and leisure travelers.

🔹 Location:
Centrally located and well-connected to key parts of the city. The hotel is part of the E-Square complex, which includes a cinema, eateries, and shopping outlets — a big plus for convenience and entertainment.

🔹 Rooms:
Spacious, clean, and thoughtfully designed. The beds were comfortable, and the in-room amenities were modern and functional. Wi-Fi speed was decent, and housekeeping was prompt.

🔹 Dining:
The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of Indian and continental options. Everything was fresh and well-prepared. Their in-house dining menu is also worth trying, especially if you're looking to unwind without stepping out.

🔹 Service:
The staff was courteous and helpful throughout the stay. Check-in and check-out were smooth, though there could be a bit more attentiveness at peak times.

🔹 Ambience:
The overall vibe is modern yet relaxed. The hotel strikes a good balance between a business-friendly environment and a comfortable leisure stay.

My recent stay at Corinthians Resort & Club was an absolutely delightful experience from start to finish. The property is lush, well-maintained, and offers a peaceful escape from the city's hustle.

While the amenities and rooms were excellent, what truly made our stay memorable was the outstanding service, particularly from Ms. Kopila Biswakarma, the Restaurant Manager.

From the moment we walked into the dining area, her warm and genuine smile set the tone. She is the epitome of professionalism and grace. She not only ensured that every meal was seamless but also went above and beyond to personalize our experience. She remembered our preferences, offered excellent recommendations from the menu, and checked on us regularly to ensure everything was perfect. Her team reflected her positive and efficient attitude, which speaks volumes about her leadership.

editorialSummary.text: Contemporary rooms in an upscale hotel featuring 5 restaurants, a spa & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
This was my third stay at JW Marriott Pune, and the consistently excellent service keeps bringing me back. Check-in was smooth and effortless as always. I appreciated the staff’s warm professionalism and their gracious refusal to accept tips, true hospitality. In-room dining was prompt and beautifully presented. The breakfast buffet is outstanding, with a well-balanced mix of local Maharashtrian favorites and international options.
Staff was ready to go above and beyond to help me recover in my delhi belly episode that I got from outside. Highly recommended for both business and leisure stays.

originalText.text:
This was my third stay at JW Marriott Pune, and the consistently excellent service keeps bringing me back. Check-in was smooth and effortless as always. I appreciated the staff’s warm professionalism and their gracious refusal to accept tips, true hospitality. In-room dining was prompt and beautifully presented. The breakfast buffet is outstanding, with a well-balanced mix of local Maharashtrian favorites and international options.
Staff was ready to go above and beyond to help me recover in my delhi belly episode that I got from outside. Highly recommended for both business and leisure stays.

text.text:
A memorable stay with warm hospitality, but marred by a persistent issue

The hotel itself is lovely — great ambiance, warm hospitality, and excellent restaurants. I truly appreciated the thoughtful upgrade to a suite, which was a wonderful gesture. The personalized welcome in the room — a platter of rose petals, soothing bath salts, and a handwritten note — reflected the attention to detail and care from the housekeeping team.

However, my experience was significantly impacted by the lack of hot water in both the shower and the wash basin. When I say no hot water, I mean completely cold — not even lukewarm. Despite raising the issue twice and following up with a third reminder over a 24-hour period, the problem remained unresolved. I was repeatedly assured it would be fixed, but unfortunately, it wasn't.

To the hotel’s credit, the senior staff at checkout were apologetic and took the time to engage with me about the issue. That said, prevention is better than cure — and when something does go wrong, a prompt resolution is critical. Operational follow-through on customer complaints needs improvement to match the otherwise excellent service standards.

While I was disappointed by this lapse, the overall experience and the staff’s warmth mean I am still likely to return — albeit with the hope that service recovery becomes as strong as the welcome.

text.text:
I recently attended a business conference focused on SMEs, and it was notable to see that most of the business owners themselves preferred to attend. Although the event was primarily meant for C-level executives, their active participation seemed natural—likely due to the convenience of travel, excellent facilities, high service standards, and the overall brand reputation of JW Marriott.

The venue offered a spacious banquet hall with a comfortable cluster-style seating arrangement. There was ample space allocated for both the bar counter and the food counters, ensuring a seamless experience.

The food was another highlight—authentic, delicious, and
thoughtfully curated. Both vegetarian and non-vegetarian options were available, served alongside a well-rounded dessert selection.

A minor drawback is that they provide regular  (not bottled) water in the rooms and charge for packaged water. Atleast 2 complimentary packaged water should be provided per night.
On busy days, parking could be an issue as i could see only 3 parking spots.

editorialSummary.text: Breezy, modest rooms in a relaxed hotel offering free parking, Wi-Fi & breakfast.

text.text:
Detailed Review – Itsy Hill View Hotel 🚫

My stay at this hotel was nothing short of a nightmare. I chose this property with certain expectations of basic comfort and hygiene, but what I experienced was shocking, unacceptable, and disgraceful for any establishment calling itself a “hotel.”

1. Bed Issue – False Promises and No Action

I explicitly requested and booked a king-sized bed. Instead, I was given two single beds pushed together. When I raised this issue, the staff promised to change the room the next day, but despite multiple follow-ups, no action was taken. This shows both carelessness and dishonesty on management’s part.

2. Unhygienic Bed Sheets and Linen

The bed sheets, blankets, pillows, and covers were filthy—full of stains, foul-smelling, and clearly not washed for a long time. I complained repeatedly and requested replacements, yet not once were they changed. This is basic housekeeping, and even budget accommodations manage to do this.

3. No Room Cleaning at All

Throughout my stay, the room was never cleaned even once. An already smelly and uncomfortable space only became more unhygienic and suffocating. This shows a complete lack of housekeeping standards.

4. Non-functional TV

The in-room TV did not work properly. After effort from room service, it barely started, but most channels were unsubscribed and the few that worked kept freezing. This is pointless and misleading advertising of “amenities.”

5. Faulty AC – Noisy and Malfunctioning

The AC was ancient, noisy, and malfunctioned throughout the night. It made scratching sounds that interrupted sleep, and its cooling was very poor. Instead of comfort, it added more disturbance.

6. Bathroom Infestation & Bedbugs

The bathroom was crawling with cockroaches coming from the sink holes, freely moving across the floor. On top of this, the bed had bedbugs—a serious health and safety violation. Such conditions are hazardous and completely unacceptable in any hospitality service.

7. Torn Curtains and Zero Privacy

The curtains were torn, unclean, and looked like they had not been replaced in years. When I opened them, a gust of dust came out. With transparent windows facing the road, the torn curtains allowed direct sunrays into the room and completely compromised privacy. This was not just inconvenient, it made the stay unbearable.

8. Pathetic Breakfast Quality

Breakfast was tasteless, poorly prepared, and of very low quality. The so-called “hot beverages” were nothing but hot water. For a hotel to serve such substandard food is insulting to guests.

Final Note

This hotel is in desperate need of complete renovation, strict pest control, staff retraining, and new management. The staff were unresponsive and dismissive despite repeated complaints.

I strongly warn fellow travelers: do not book this hotel under any circumstance—even if it were offered for free. It is unhygienic, mismanaged, and unsafe.

text.text:
Writing the review after staying for 11 days...
Rooms :
Rooms are good... They are just good, a lot smaller than what I had expected and don't feel worthy for the amount you pay to stay at the hotel... They are not that luxurious.

Service :
Room service : The treatment at the hotel is good. The room cleaning service is fine. The hospitality is really well managed. All the feedback is well considered and made sure that they are followed well and respected.

Laundry Service : The laundry and pressing are the worst services, there are high chances of clothes getting spoiled after the wash and pressing... I lost 2 of my t-shirts.

Complimentary pickup and drop-off to office is very well managed and right on-time always.

Food :
Best for Breakfast - Idli, Poha, Fruits... Parathas and Dosas from the live counter are served hot and taste authentic. English breakfast option is also made available and croissant 🥐, beans, scrambled eggs, cakes and lot other options are available.
Best for In Room Dining - Peas masala, Dhal Tadka, Panner tandoori are served well and taste great Babycorn pepper dry (not in the menu) but the chef custom made this for me and it was great.

Sathyam, one of the hotel staffs is a very good person who treats you well, does his job professionally well.

text.text:
I rarely write reviews, but this hotel deserves a warning label. I honestly can’t understand how this place holds a 3-star rating — I’ve had better nights sleeping in airport lounges.
Where do I start? The moment I walked in, I was greeted by a front desk clerk who looked like they’d rather be anywhere else. No smile, no welcome, just a grunt and a demand for ID. The lobby smelled strangely of damp carpet and cheap cleaning spray trying in vain to cover it up.
Got to my room (eventually, since the elevator was slower than a dial-up connection) to find stained bedsheets, cigarette burns on the curtains, and a bathroom that looked like it hadn’t seen bleach in a year. There was mold in the shower, cracked tiles, and a toilet that barely flushed. The towels were thin, scratchy, and damp — as if re-used from the previous guests.

the reception staff at this hotel are the single worst part of what was already a terrible stay. I’ve never dealt with people so indifferent, unfriendly, and flat-out rude in all my travels. Whoever’s hiring here clearly just picks names out of a hat labeled “People Who Hate Guests.”
From the moment I arrived, the front desk looked annoyed that I even dared walk through the door. No greeting, no smile — just a long sigh followed by “ID?” like I was bothering them. I tried to ask a couple of basic questions about check-out and breakfast times, and the receptionist literally rolled their eyes like I’d asked them to solve world hunger.

text.text:
Our four-day stay at The Westin was our first experience with this esteemed brand, and we arrived with the high expectations that naturally accompany a luxury five-star hotel. Celebrating our anniversary, we were simply looking for a relaxing staycation to unwind and enjoy each other's company.

For the most part, our experience was indeed lovely. The hotel undeniably possesses the hallmarks of a five-star establishment. The food and drinks were a definite highlight, and we particularly enjoyed the extensive breakfast buffet. However, if you're planning a longer stay like ours, be aware that the buffet options might become a tad repetitive. The hotel also boasts excellent amenities, including a spa that we thoroughly enjoyed. Our balcony room was comfortable, featuring an exceptionally comfortable bed and prompt service whenever we requested it. The staff across the hotel were consistently polite and courteous.

However, our stay was unfortunately punctuated by a series of unexpected hiccups that left us somewhat surprised, especially given the hotel's reputation. On one occasion, I was quite taken aback to find a piece of glass in my food during the breakfast buffet. While the staff were quick to apologize and address the situation, it was certainly a concerning incident.

My wife's experience with the salon was also disappointing. Despite enquiring a day in advance about curly hair products for a hair spa, the salon was unable to accommodate her needs. Furthermore, one day our room was missed during the cleaning service, even after we had specifically requested it. On our final night, we requested room service to clean our room upon our return, only to find that while the bed was tidied, the rubbish, trays, and the balcony remained untouched.

Speaking of the balcony, while it was a nice addition to our room, it ultimately felt underwhelming. Furnished with just a simple table and chairs and offering no shade from the intense daytime sun, it was unusable during the day. In the evenings, the abundance of mosquitos made it equally uninviting. The view from our room was also just satisfactory, with nearby buildings obstructing the sunrise.

Despite these issues, I must acknowledge the hotel's commendable service recovery efforts. The staff consistently apologized for each incident and genuinely tried their best to rectify the situations. This proactive approach to service was definitely appreciated.

Ultimately, our anniversary staycation at The Westin Koregaon Park was a blend of positive and negative experiences. While the hotel offers many of the luxuries and services one expects from a five-star establishment, the series of unfortunate incidents we encountered during our short stay was surprising. It leaves us questioning whether it was simply bad luck or if there are underlying inconsistencies. While we appreciated the good aspects like the food, the comfortable room, and the polite staff, and especially their attempts to make things right, the repeated issues did detract from the seamless and relaxing experience we had hoped for. The salon, in particular, could benefit from better-trained staff who are knowledgeable about all the services offered.

text.text: I recently attended the National Education Summit at this location and found it to be a delightful venue. editorialSummary.text: Informal hotel offering a cafe, a restaurant & a bar/lounge, plus free Wi-Fi & breakfast.

text.text:
We booked a room at Super Townhouse Oak for one day, which cost us ₹2,000. At this price range, you generally expect good service and a well-maintained room, but unfortunately, our experience was the opposite.

The TV was only for show, with no channels available. In the name of toiletries, there was just one soap and one towel. There was no hot water in the bathroom; I had to go down to the reception in the morning to request soap, a towel, and hot water. They gave me a heating rod as a solution. The bathroom had no hangers or hooks to hang clothes. We also saw small cockroaches moving around.

Other than that, the room itself was nice and the AC worked well.

I would suggest that management pay attention to these issues or at least ensure that the basic facilities are available for guests.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Lemon Tree Hotel Vimannagar, and I must say it was a truly delightful experience. From the moment I walked through the doors, the hotel's warm and inviting atmosphere captivated me. The exceptional service and attention to detail exceeded my expectations in every way possible.

The staff at Lemon Tree Hotel Vimannagar truly went above and beyond to ensure my comfort and satisfaction throughout my stay. Their friendly and welcoming demeanor made me feel right at home. They were always ready to assist with any queries or requests, displaying an unmatched level of professionalism.

The room I stayed in was spacious, clean, and beautifully designed. It had all the amenities one could ask for, including a comfortable bed, a well-stocked minibar, and a modern bathroom. The attention to detail was evident in the meticulous cleanliness and thoughtfully arranged furnishings.

What impressed me the most was the hotel's commitment to providing an exceptional guest experience. They offered me a free late check-out option, allowing me to relax and enjoy my stay without feeling rushed. Furthermore, the complimentary drop-off service to the airport was an unexpected and generous gesture that made my departure hassle-free.

The dining options at Lemon Tree Hotel Vimannagar were fantastic. The breakfast buffet showcased a wide variety of delicious dishes, catering to different tastes and dietary preferences. The restaurant staff was attentive, ensuring that every guest was taken care of with a smile.

The hotel's location in Vimannagar was ideal for both business and leisure travelers. It provided easy access to the airport and was in close proximity to several popular attractions and shopping centers. Additionally, the surrounding neighborhood felt safe and vibrant, with numerous dining and entertainment options within walking distance.

Overall, my stay at Lemon Tree Hotel Vimannagar was nothing short of exceptional. The staff's dedication to providing impeccable service, the comfortable and well-appointed rooms, and the thoughtful amenities created a memorable experience for me. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area and look forward to returning on my future trips.

text.text: We are there in March/April, Pune’s weather - morning cool, afternoon hot, night cool but somehow dusty. The Hotel’s meals are great and authentic, recommend you to go the hotel’s outdoor dining area for your breakfast, it’s very cool with morning sun. The staffs are friendly and great hospitality. The room are neat and clean. The best part is mineral waters are provided free of charge EVERYDAY -> 2 in bathroom, 2 on table, 2 on each side of the bed, total 8 bottles per day. We bought extra 3 big mineral bottles from phoenix mall, apparently there is no need to buy since the hotel’s mineral waters are sufficient for each day usage. text.text:
Had a pleasant stay at The E-Square The Fern Hotel in Pune, and it's definitely a place I’d recommend for both business and leisure travelers.

🔹 Location:
Centrally located and well-connected to key parts of the city. The hotel is part of the E-Square complex, which includes a cinema, eateries, and shopping outlets — a big plus for convenience and entertainment.

🔹 Rooms:
Spacious, clean, and thoughtfully designed. The beds were comfortable, and the in-room amenities were modern and functional. Wi-Fi speed was decent, and housekeeping was prompt.

🔹 Dining:
The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of Indian and continental options. Everything was fresh and well-prepared. Their in-house dining menu is also worth trying, especially if you're looking to unwind without stepping out.

🔹 Service:
The staff was courteous and helpful throughout the stay. Check-in and check-out were smooth, though there could be a bit more attentiveness at peak times.

🔹 Ambience:
The overall vibe is modern yet relaxed. The hotel strikes a good balance between a business-friendly environment and a comfortable leisure stay.

text.text:
Beautiful resort in Greek and Egyptian architecture on the outskirts of Pune.
The property is huge spread across 20 acres.
The rooms that we got were  renovated, modern, spacious ,clean, and well kept.
There is a game room with few free and chargeable activities for the kids.
Board games are free, and electronic games, PSP, and VR have nominal charges.
Breakfast spread was good.
They have high tea as well with snacks, which was decent.
Special mention to the staff Mahrab at Salsa restaurant who was outstanding and courteous, where we had dined twice. Food too was very good at the Salsa restaurant with quick and prompt service.
Hotel is located almost 40-45 mins from NH 48.
The gym looked outdated and needs to be revamped.
Overall, it was a good experience, and I would highly recommend this place for the calm environment and amazing service.

text.text:
I recently stayed at your hotel for 7 days. While I truly appreciated the warm hospitality and courteous service from your staff, I would like to share a few areas of improvement for your consideration:
•	The hotel room, and especially the bathroom, felt quite cramped. The bathroom size and layout were very uncomfortable, giving the feeling of a railway washroom, which was quite unexpected from a hotel of your brand.
•	The breakfast menu was repetitive every day — mostly the same items like sambhar, idli, and poha. I was expecting more variety and better quality as per the standards your brand usually represents.

That said, I would like to sincerely thank your staff for their friendly behavior and prompt service throughout our stay. Their positive attitude truly made our experience more comfortable.

Looking forward to seeing some improvements, and I hope to have an even better stay next time.

text.text:
Title: A Culinary Haven with Unmatched Luxury: JW Marriott Hotel Pune

Review:

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the JW Marriott Hotel in Pune, and I must say it was an unforgettable experience from start to finish. From the moment I stepped into the hotel, I was captivated by its luxurious ambiance and warm hospitality. Every aspect, from the exquisite food to the impeccable service, contributed to making my stay truly exceptional.

Let's start with the food. The culinary offerings at JW Marriott Pune are simply outstanding. The hotel boasts a variety of dining options, each with its own unique charm. Whether you prefer authentic Indian cuisine, international delicacies, or indulgent desserts, this hotel has it all. The flavors, presentation, and quality of the food were consistently top-notch, and I found myself looking forward to every meal. The skilled chefs take great pride in their craft, and it's evident in every dish they create.

The hotel's restaurants offer a delightful ambiance that complements the culinary experience perfectly. The decor is elegant, with a blend of modern and traditional elements, creating a sophisticated yet comfortable atmosphere. Whether you're enjoying a romantic dinner at Shakahari, the hotel's vegetarian specialty restaurant, or having a casual lunch at Alto Vino, their Italian eatery, you'll be surrounded by an inviting setting that enhances the dining experience.

What truly sets JW Marriott Pune apart is its exceptional service. The staff members are genuinely attentive, friendly, and go above and beyond to ensure every guest feels welcomed and cared for. From the warm greetings at the entrance to the prompt and efficient service at the restaurants, the staff consistently exceeded my expectations. They were always ready to accommodate special requests and provide helpful recommendations, making me feel like a valued guest throughout my stay.

In addition to the outstanding food, atmosphere, and service, the hotel offers a range of amenities that further enhance the overall experience. The well-equipped fitness center, luxurious spa, and refreshing swimming pool provided opportunities to unwind and rejuvenate after a busy day. The attention to detail in every aspect of the hotel's design and facilities truly reflects the commitment to excellence that JW Marriott is known for.

Overall, my stay at JW Marriott Hotel Pune was nothing short of exceptional. The combination of delectable food, inviting ambiance, and exceptional service created an experience that exceeded all my expectations. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a luxurious and memorable stay in Pune. Whether you're a food enthusiast, a traveler seeking comfort and relaxation, or someone who appreciates the finer things in life, JW Marriott Pune will leave an indelible impression on you.

text.text:
Title: Disappointing Experience at JW Marriott Pune

I recently had the opportunity to stay at JW Marriott Pune, and unfortunately, it was one of the most disappointing experiences I have ever had in a hotel. As someone who has stayed in numerous luxury accommodations around the world and experienced the best of hospitality, I was shocked by the subpar level of service provided at this establishment.

Firstly, the quality of the food was far from satisfactory. The dal, vegetable curries, and other dishes were served cold, which was extremely disappointing. Additionally, the wait time for ordering was excessively long, making the dining experience frustrating and time-consuming.

Moreover, the lack of coordination among the staff was evident throughout my visit. For instance, when my family and I arrived for lunch, we were informed that the buffet would be available until 3:30 PM. However, to our dismay, it closed earlier than promised, preventing us from enjoying a meal. Despite this inconvenience, we were still charged for the full buffet, which seemed unfair and insensitive.

Another area of concern was the room service. Numerous attempts to reach them went unanswered, leaving us feeling ignored and neglected. The unprofessional behavior exhibited by the staff further exacerbated our frustration. Their indifference and lack of care gave the impression that they did not value their guests.

Given my experience, I would strongly advise against wasting your money on a hotel that fails to meet even the basic standards of hospitality. The JW Marriott Pune left a lot to be desired, and I regret choosing it for my stay. I sincerely hope that the management takes note of these issues and makes the necessary improvements to ensure a more pleasant experience for future guests.

Swaroop Hotel is one of the best affordable options in the Heart of Pune - The Prabhat Road area. The Property welcomes you with a decent cozy greenery and Warm welcome at the Reception. The Rooms are clean, Staff is prompt and courteous. There is a range of Breakfast Options available and good food served from the Kitchen for Dinner and Lunch.

Their Bhindi Fry was one to remember and you must try it for regular dine in too. The Dal Tadka Rice, Chinese Cuisine and Phulka Roti are one to ask for sumptuous meal.

Breakfast has Uttappam, Dosa, Upma, Sambhar, Puri Bhaaji, Bread Toast and Egg Omlette along with Tailor made Tea and Coffee.

text.text:
*5/5 Stars*

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Radisson Blu for almost 20 days and I must say, it was an exceptional experience from start to finish! The hotel's modern amenities, impeccable cleanliness, and comfortable rooms made for a wonderful stay.

I had my wedding reception in the hotel's banquet hall and the food they provided was delicious

However, what truly made our stay stand out was the outstanding service provided by the hotel staff. From the warm welcome at check-in to the helpful concierge team, every interaction was met with a smile and a willingness to assist.
We did had some issues with key access that the staff was quickley resolved

The hotel's restaurant/bar was also a highlight, serving delicious food/drinks in a cozy and inviting atmosphere.

I would highly recommend Radisson Blu to anyone looking for a comfortable and enjoyable stay. The combination of excellent facilities and top-notch service makes it a true gem.

Thank you to the entire team at Radisson Blu for making our stay so memorable!"

A special thanks to Mr Flavian Clayton who took care of all bookings and requirements.
Mr Akshay kumar Sahoo was also polite and helpful
Grateful to cleaning staff Utkarsh and team

*Rating Breakdown:*

- Cleanliness: 5/5
- Comfort: 5/5
- Service: 5/5
- Facilities: 5/5
- Value: 5/5

text.text:
"I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Radisson Blu Pune Kharadi, and it exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I was greeted with warmth and hospitality by akansha. The check-in process was seamless, and she was incredibly courteous and attentive throughout my stay.

The room was spacious, modern, and impeccably clean, providing a perfect retreat after a long day of exploring Pune. The comfortable bed ensured a restful night's sleep, and the amenities provided added an extra touch of luxury to my stay.

One of the highlights of my experience was the dining options at the hotel. The breakfast buffet offered an impressive spread of both local and international cuisines, catering to all tastes and preferences. Service was immense by Parth, Aniket, Nitin and Tejaswini. Additionally, I had the opportunity to dine at the The kabab factory restaurant, where I was treated to delicious dishes prepared with the freshest ingredients by chef Zameer.

The hotel's location in Kharadi is also worth mentioning, as it provides easy access to both the business district and popular tourist attractions. Whether you're visiting Pune for business or leisure, the Radisson Blu Pune Kharadi is the perfect choice for a memorable stay.

Overall, I highly recommend the Radisson Blu Pune Kharadi to anyone looking for a comfortable, luxurious, and conveniently located hotel in Pune. The impeccable service, modern amenities, and attention to detail truly set it apart from the rest."

text.text:
Whenever I plan a trip to pune, my first priority is checking whether sayba international has rooms available — only then do I think about my work schedule.
This hotel is truly outstanding, from its generously sized rooms and bathrooms to the beautiful common spaces like the lobby and restaurants. Every corner exudes luxury, but it’s a relaxed, welcoming kind of luxury. Honestly, if I could have packed the bed and taken it home, I would have — it’s hands down the most comfortable bed I’ve ever slept on. It sounds crazy, but it’s absolutely true.
